is

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition
member.summary: stanza error condition as defined in RFC 3920 9.3

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.BadRequest
F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Conflict
member.summary: Access cannot be granted because an existing resource exists with the same name or address; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.FeatureNotImplemented
member.summary: The feature represented in the XML stanza is not implemented by the intended recipient or an intermediate server and therefore the stanza cannot be processed; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel" or "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Forbidden
member.summary: The requesting entity does not possess the required permissions to perform the action; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Gone
F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.InternalServerError
member.summary: The server could not process the stanza because of a misconfiguration or an otherwise-undefined internal server error; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait" or "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.ItemNotFound
member.summary: The addressed JID or item requested cannot be found; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel" or "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.JidMalformed
member.summary: The sending entity has provided or communicated an XMPP address (e.g., a value of the 'to' attribute) or aspect thereof (e.g., an XMPP resource identifier) that does not adhere to the syntax defined under RFC3920 Section 3 (Addresses); the associated error type SHOULD be "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotAcceptable
member.summary: The recipient or server understands the request but is refusing to process it because it does not meet criteria defined by the recipient or server (e.g., a local policy regarding stanza size limits or acceptable words in messages); the associated error type SHOULD be "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotAllowed
member.summary: The recipient or server does not allow any entity to perform the action (e.g., sending to entities at a blacklisted domain); the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotAuthorized
member.summary: The sender must provide proper credentials before being allowed to perform the action, or has provided improper credentials; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.NotModified
member.summary: The item requested has not changed since it was last requested; the associated error type SHOULD be "continue".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.PaymentRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because payment is required; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RecipientUnavailable
member.summary: The intended recipient is temporarily unavailable; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait".
member.remarks: An application MUST NOT return this error if doing so would provide information about the intended recipient's network availability to an entity that is not authorized to know such information; instead it SHOULD return a <service-unavailable/> error.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.Redirect
member.summary: The recipient or server is redirecting requests for this information to another entity, typically in a temporary fashion; the associated error type SHOULD be "modify" and the error stanza SHOULD contain the alternate address (which SHOULD be a valid JID) in the XML character data of the <redirect/> element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RegistrationRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because prior registration is required; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RemoteServerNotFound
member.summary: A remote server or service specified as part or all of the JID of the intended recipient does not exist; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.RemoteServerTimeout
member.summary: A remote server or service specified as part or all of the JID of the intended recipient (or required to fulfill a request) could not be contacted within a reasonable amount of time; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.ResourceConstraint
member.summary: The server or recipient lacks the system resources necessary to service the request; the associated error type SHOULD be "wait".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The server or recipient does not currently provide the requested service; the associated error type SHOULD be "cancel".
member.remarks: An application SHOULD return a <service-unavailable/> error instead of <item-not-found/> or <recipient-unavailable/> if sending one of the latter errors would provide information about the intended recipient's network availability to an entity that is not authorized to know such information.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.SubscriptionRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because a prior subscription is required; the associated error type SHOULD be "auth".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.UndefinedCondition
F:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.ErrorCondition.UnexpectedRequest
member.summary: The recipient or server understood the request but was not expecting it at this time (e.g., the request was out of order); the associated error type SHOULD be "wait" or "modify".

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.XData.FieldType.Fixed
member.summary: The field is intended for data description (e.g., human-readable text such as "section" headers) rather than data gathering or provision. member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.XData.Field.Description
member.summary: The data of this element provides a natural-language description of the field, intended for presentation in a user-agent (e.g., as a "tool-tip", help button, or explanatory text provided near the field). The <desc/> element SHOULD NOT contain newlines (the \n and \r characters), since layout is the responsibility of a user agent, and any handling of newlines (e.g., presentation in a user interface) is unspecified herein. (Note: To provide a description of a field, it is RECOMMENDED to use a <desc/> element rather than a separate <field/> element of type "fixed".)

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.UnknownCondition
member.summary: unknown error condition

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.BadFormat
member.summary: the entity has sent XML that cannot be processed; this error MAY be used instead of the more specific XML-related errors, such as <bad-namespace-prefix/>, <invalid-xml/>, <restricted-xml/>, <unsupported-encoding/>, and <xml-not-well-formed/>, although the more specific errors are preferred.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.BadNamespacePrefix
member.summary: the entity has sent a namespace prefix that is unsupported, or has sent no namespace prefix on an element that requires such a prefix (see XML Namespace Names and Prefixes (XML Namespace Names and Prefixes)).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.Conflict
member.summary: the server is closing the active stream for this entity because a new stream has been initiated that conflicts with the existing stream.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: the entity has not generated any traffic over the stream for some period of time (configurable according to a local service policy).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.HostGone
member.summary: the value of the 'to' attribute provided by the initiating entity in the stream header corresponds to a hostname that is no longer hosted by the server.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.HostUnknown
member.summary: the value of the 'to' attribute provided by the initiating entity in the stream header does not correspond to a hostname that is hosted by the server.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.ImproperAddressing
member.summary: a stanza sent between two servers lacks a 'to' or 'from' attribute (or the attribute has no value).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.InternalServerError
member.summary: the server has experienced a misconfiguration or an otherwise-undefined internal error that prevents it from servicing the stream.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.InvalidFrom
member.summary: the JID or hostname provided in a 'from' address does not match an authorized JID or validated domain negotiated between servers via SASL or dialback, or between a client and a server via authentication and resource binding.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.InvalidId
member.summary: the stream ID or dialback ID is invalid or does not match an ID previously provided.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.InvalidNamespace
member.summary: the streams namespace name is something other than "http://etherx.jabber.org/streams" or the dialback namespace name is something other than "jabber:server:dialback" (see XML Namespace Names and Prefixes (XML Namespace Names and Prefixes)).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.InvalidXml
member.summary: the entity has sent invalid XML over the stream to a server that performs validation.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.NotAuthorized
member.summary: the entity has attempted to send data before the stream has been authenticated, or otherwise is not authorized to perform an action related to stream negotiation; the receiving entity MUST NOT process the offending stanza before sending the stream error.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.PolicyViolation
member.summary: the entity has violated some local service policy; the server MAY choose to specify the policy in the <text/> element or an application-specific condition element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.RemoteConnectionFailed
member.summary: the server is unable to properly connect to a remote entity that is required for authentication or authorization.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.ResourceConstraint
member.summary: the server lacks the system resources necessary to service the stream.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.RestrictedXml
member.summary: the entity has attempted to send restricted XML features such as a comment, processing instruction, DTD, entity reference, or unescaped character (see Restrictions (Restrictions)).

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.SeeOtherHost
F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.SystemShutdown
member.summary: the server is being shut down and all active streams are being closed.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.UndefinedCondition
member.summary: the error condition is not one of those defined by the other conditions in this list; this error condition SHOULD be used only in conjunction with an application-specific condition.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.UnsupportedEncoding
member.summary: the initiating entity has encoded the stream in an encoding that is not supported by the server.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.UnsupportedStanzaType
member.summary: the initiating entity has sent a first-level child of the stream that is not supported by the server.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.UnsupportedVersion
member.summary: the value of the 'version' attribute provided by the initiating entity in the stream header specifies a version of XMPP that is not supported by the server; the server MAY specify the version(s) it supports in the <text/> element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Stream.ErrorCondition.XmlNotWellFormed
member.summary: the initiating entity has sent XML that is not well-formed as defined by the XML specs.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.Base.Presence.Type
member.summary: The type of a presence stanza is OPTIONAL. A presence stanza that does not possess a type attribute is used to signal to the server that the sender is online and available for communication. If included, the type attribute specifies a lack of availability, a request to manage a subscription to another entity's presence, a request for another entity's current presence, or an error related to a previously-sent presence stanza.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.aborted
member.summary: The receiving entity acknowledges an element sent by the initiating entity; sent in reply to the element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.incorrect_encoding
member.summary: The data provided by the initiating entity could not be processed because the [BASE64] (Josefsson, S., The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings, July 2003.) encoding is incorrect (e.g., because the encoding does not adhere to the definition in Section 3 of [BASE64] (Josefsson, S., The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings, July 2003.)); sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.invalid_authzid
member.summary: The authzid provided by the initiating entity is invalid, either because it is incorrectly formatted or because the initiating entity does not have permissions to authorize that ID; sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.invalid_mechanism
member.summary: The initiating entity did not provide a mechanism or requested a mechanism that is not supported by the receiving entity; sent in reply to an element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.mechanism_too_weak
member.summary: The mechanism requested by the initiating entity is weaker than server policy permits for that initiating entity; sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.not_authorized
member.summary: The authentication failed because the initiating entity did not provide valid credentials (this includes but is not limited to the case of an unknown username); sent in reply to a element or an element with initial response data.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.temporary_auth_failure
member.summary: The authentication failed because of a temporary error condition within the receiving entity; sent in reply to an element or element.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.Sasl.FailureCondition.UnknownCondition
member.summary: Unknown Condition

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.MucManager.GrantVoice(Matrix.Jid,System.String)
member.summary:
Granting voice to a visitor.
In a moderated room, a moderator may want to manage who does and does not have "voice" in the room (i.e., the ability to send messages to all occupants). Voice is granted based on the visitor's room nickname, which the service will convert into the visitor's full JID internally. The moderator grants voice to a visitor by changing the visitor's role to "participant".

member.name: M:Matrix.Xmpp.Client.MucManager.GrantMembership(Matrix.Jid,Matrix.Jid)
member.summary:
Grant membership.
An admin can grant membership to a user; this is done by changing the user's affiliation to "member" (normally based on nick if the user is in the room, or on bare JID if not; in either case, if the nick is provided, that nick becomes the user's default nick in the room if that functionality is supported by the implementation).

member.summary:

In a moderated room, a moderator may want to revoke a participant's privileges to speak. The moderator can revoke voice from a participant by changing the participant's role to "visitor".

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSocket.Hold

member.name: P:Matrix.Net.BoshSocket.MaxPause
member.summary: If the connection manager supports session pausing (see Inactivity) then it SHOULD advertise that to the client by including a 'maxpause' attribute in the session creation response element. The value of the attribute indicates the maximum length of a temporary session pause (in seconds) that a client MAY request. 0 is the default value and indicated that the connection manager supports no session pausing.

member.name: F:Matrix.Xmpp.PubSub.SubscriptionState.subscribed

list.item: All must stand alone, its not allowed to combine thsi flag
Message, Iq, IncomingPresence and Outgoing Presence could be combined, but its not allowed to combine more than 3 of this flag. If you need all of them you have to use the All flag

member.name: T:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI
member.summary: XEP-0095: Stream Initiation

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.Id
member.summary: An opaque identifier. This value MUST be present on type='set', and MUST be a valid string. This SHOULD NOT be sent back on type='result', since the Id provides the only context needed. This value is generated by the Sender, and the same value MUST be used throughout a session when talking to the Receiver.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.MimeType
member.summary: Iidentifies the MIME-type for the data across the stream. This value MUST be a valid MIME-type as registered with the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) [3] (specifically, as listed at "http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types"). During negotiation, this value SHOULD be present, and is otherwise not required. If not included during negotiation, its value is assumed to be "binary/octect-stream".

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.StreamInitiation.SI.Profile
member.summary: Defines the SI profile in use. This value MUST be present during negotiation, and is the namespace of the profile to use.

member.summary: Gets or sets the file.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Jid
member.summary: Is used to specify a simple Jabber ID associated with this address. If the Jid is specified, the Uri proprty MUST NOT be set.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Description
member.summary: The Description is used to specify human-readable information for this address. This data may be used by clients to provide richer address-book integration.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Node
member.summary: This property is used to specify a sub-addressable unit at a particular JID, corresponding to a Service Discovery node. A node property MAY be set if a 'Jid' is specified. If a 'Uri' is specified, the 'Node' MUST NOT be specified.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Uri
member.summary: Is used to specify an external system address, such as a sip:, sips:, or im: URI. If the Uri is set, the Jid and Node peroperties MUST NOT be specified.

member.name: P:Matrix.Xmpp.ExtendedStanzaAddressing.Address.Delivered
member.summary: When a multicast service delivers the stanza to a non-bcc address, it MUST set Delivered = true. A multicast service MUST NOT deliver to an address that was marked with Delivered = true when the service received the stanza. A multicast service SHOULD attempt to deliver to all addresses that are not marked with Delivered = true.
